DataElement.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Progression Or Recurrence Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The text term used to describe the type of worsening or reemergence of disease over time.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Progression Or Recurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:A process that manifests as the worsening of a disease over time._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._The reemergence of a neoplasm after a period of remission.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: A process that manifests as the worsening of a disease over time._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._The reemergence of a neoplasm after a period of remission.

Concepts.definition: A process that manifests as the worsening of a disease over time.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
The reemergence of a neoplasm after a period of remission.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

DataElementConcept.administrativeNotes: 5/17/23 changed origin to CDS. BF; 5/8/23 Created per CDS metadata template. mr

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A disease or condition that extends beyond the site and spreads into adjacent tissues and regional lymph nodes.

Concepts.definition: A disease or condition that extends beyond the site and spreads into adjacent tissues and regional lymph nodes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A disease that is confined to a specific organ or tissue and has not spread to other anatomic sites.

Concepts.definition: A disease that is confined to a specific organ or tissue and has not spread to other anatomic sites.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that biochemical markers of a disease are present.

Concepts.definition: An indication that biochemical markers of a disease are present.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A biological process that involves the transfer and growth of cancer cells from the site of the primary tumor. Relocation of malignant cells during metastasis can be restricted to movement within a specific tissue/organ or may entail migration to a distal locus within the body. This phenotype is a characteristic of all malignant tumors.

Concepts.definition: A biological process that involves the transfer and growth of cancer cells from the site of the primary tumor. Relocation of malignant cells during metastasis can be restricted to movement within a specific tissue/organ or may entail migration to a distal locus within the body. This phenotype is a characteristic of all malignant tumors.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
